symbol.name: Asterisk
symbol.description: Zero or more phones or diacritics

symbol.name: Plus sign
symbol.description: One or more phones or diacritics

symbol.name: Lower-case L
symbol.description: Voiced dental or alveolar lateral approximant

symbol.name: OBSOLETE IPA - Replaced with labialized z or ð
symbol.usage: OBSOLETE IPA - Replaced with labialized z or ð

symbol.name: Left-hook T
symbol.description: Palatalized voiceless dental or alveolar plosive

symbol.name: Hooktop heng
symbol.description: Simultaneous voiceless postalveolar and velar fricative

symbol.name: L with tilde
symbol.description: Velarized voiced dental or alveolar lateral approximant

symbol.name: Belted L
symbol.description: Voiceless dental or alveolar lateral fricative

symbol.name: L-Ezh ligature
symbol.description: Voiced dental or alveolar lateral fricative

symbol.name: Long-leg R
symbol.description: Voiced strident apico-alveolar trill (that is, ř in the Czech orthography)

symbol.name: Reversed fish-hook R
symbol.description: Apical dental unrounded syllabic alveolar fricative

symbol.name: Reversed fish-hook R with tail
symbol.description: Apical retroflex unrounded syllabic alveolar fricative

symbol.name: Curvy turned H
symbol.description: Apical dental rounded syllabic alveolar fricative

symbol.name: Right-tail curvy turned H
symbol.description: Apical dental rounded syllabic retroflex fricative

symbol.name: Superscript hooktop H
symbol.usage: To indicate that a plosive is breathy voiced, use 405

change.title: Specify Fricative manner of articulation for symbols in the Approximant row. For example, if the base character is [w], the diacritic specifies a voiced labial-velar central fricative.

otherwise.title: Modify articulation of consonants or vowels.

change.title: Specify Fricative manner of articulation for symbols in the Plosive row. For example, if the base character is [t], the diacritic specifies a voiceless alveolar fricative-like sound without the grooved tongue shape of [s].
Specify Approximant manner of articulation for symbols in the Fricative row. For example, if the base character is [ɣ], the diacritic specifies a voiced velar central approximant.

otherwise.title: Modify articulation of consonants or vowels.

change.title: Specify Bilabial place of articulation for symbols in the Labiodental column (specifically, labiodental flap).
Specify Dental place of articulation for symbols in the Alveolar column.

otherwise.title: Modify other places of articulation for consonants, backness for vowels.

change.title: Specify Alveolar if the place of articulation of a phone has been changed to Dental (for example, [t] in Tamil).
Specify Postalveolar place of articulation for symbols in the Alveolar column.

otherwise.title: Modify other places of articulation for consonants, backness for vowels.

change.title: Specify Dental place of articulation for symbols in the Alveolar column.
Specify Dental place of articulation for symbols in the Alveolar column.
Specify Linguolabial place of articulation for symbols in the Dental column (for example, fricative).
Specify Linguolabial place of articulation for symbols in the Alveolar column (for example, plosive).

symbol.name: Small capital A
symbol.usage: Used by phoneticians in China Replaced with U+00E4

symbol.name: Small capital E
symbol.description: Mid front unrounded vowel between [e] and [ɛ]

add.title: Distinguish meaning of diacritic when it precedes the base character.
Distinguish meaning of diacritic when it precedes the base character.
Distinguish meaning of diacritic when it precedes the base character.
Distinguish meaning of diacritic when it precedes the base character.

symbol.name: Grave plus acute plus grave accent

add.title: Distinguish meaning of diacritic when it precedes the base character.

pattern.title: Plosive + Lateral Fricative or Lateral Approximant: Lateral Affricate.
Nasal + Plosive + Plosive (primary): Prenasalized Double Articulation.
Nasal + Plosive (primary) + Plosive: Prenasalized Double Articulation.
Nasal + Nasal + Plosive + Plosive (primary): Prenasalized Double Articulation.
Nasal + Nasal + Plosive (primary) + Plosive: Prenasalized Double Articulation.

change.title: For glottal plosive, state of glottis is redundant.
For epiglottal plosive, state of glottis is redundant. IS THIS TRUE? See LM 60.
For any vowel, voiced is omitted.
For other states of glottis, voiced is redundant (or even incorrect).
For some manners of articulation, lateral is redundant.
If a vowel has a more specific rounding feature, rounded is redundant.
For two central vowels, rounded is omitted.
Replace rhoticity with r-colored.
In place of articulation pairs for clicks, do not replace bilabial with labial.
In place of articulation pairs, replace bilabial with labial.
In secondary articulation pairs, replace labialized with labial.
Replace no audible release with unreleased (preceding the manner of articulation).
Insert with preceding advanced/retracted tongue root
Name of click does not include dorsal place of articulation
Name of click does not include dorsal place of articulation
